Phobias eyes widen, was this bot accually suggesting diplomacy?

"No you shouldn't contact them, They're Predacons, they're programmed 
to lie. Every word out of their vocal circuits is a lie."
he realized the situation he was putting Kluster in.
"Do you want them to know you have a functional ship? When they scan 
you and detect Predacon technology what do you think will happen? 
Either they'll destroy you for stealing it or they'll know that 
theres a traitor in the ranks. How long until they realize it's me?"

Phobia didn't want the Cybertronian Fire fail in it's mission, he 
knew that the fate of two worlds rested in the hands of an 
inexperienced bot as far as temporal conflict goes.

OOC another idea could be to transfer the engines over to the Ark 
after the battle.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Kluster::
> 
> Kluster nods. "Perhaps we should try contacting them about their 
intentions 
> first, though. We still need to got back to Cybertron, and getting 
this ship 
> disabled does nothing to achieve that goal."
